messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. Living in the best possible health is very important to you. You are someone who I agree with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings sometimes. I neutral that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I agree that my well-being is good. I strongly agree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I strongly agree that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel I am very capable of making all appropriate decisions. I have been taking Alcatel of not only my self but family and children for over 10 years now.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care doctor. I have been with the same person for 4years and she is very knowledgeable and always on point with treatment and what to do
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel anxious or worried when I get blood drawn while being pregnant because there are so many things a child can get. I always worry til the results are in
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was getting a pap done and was told I had cancer. it was a very difficult time for me to go threw. I was all alone and had Noone to help with the process

My capacity use slightly limited by my fibromyalgia, but generally, if given enough time, I understand the information I'm given.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor usually takes plenty of time to talk about my concerns; I almost never feel rushed. She is kind, concerned and considerate
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am sometimes worried that I can't convey my issues well enough. I'm also cognisant of other people waiting, so I don't want to take too much time.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have fibromyalgia and chronic daily headaches as well as frequent migraines. I have been to many doctors - pain specialists, neurologists, etc. - as well as chiropractors

i can completely understand basic health informations and services if needed to make decisions about my health
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
too busy and they can't be bothered to sit actually listen to what you have to say. your just a number to them
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
having testing done but not knowing what the results might be which can cause someone to be anxious or concern
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
the only thing i can think of is being given antibiotics to take for something and i understood what was expected of me

i have a lot of internet and easy understanding of materials.it is easy to understand and help others in the same situation
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
i trust my doctor the are very good and care about my needs and questions.i see him twice a year and do tests
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
my blood pressure is high and my weight is higher.if i feel anxious and how to handle it.if i have to do some other tests
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
when i fold out i had a kidney stone gallstones and i needed my gallbladder out of my body.i tried to use home remedies to help with pain and ease

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel like my doctors are very friendly and committed to making me feel comfortable as a patient. They have done a fantastic job and I would come to them for anything.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust him because he's been our family's primary care physician for a long time now. He is very helpful and courteous
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I get worried that I will have to get shots. I've had a phobia of them for a while
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My sister is training to be a nurse so I have some kind of history with medical knowledge

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I can get and obtain basic health information with no problem. My go to would being doing research online if I really didn't understand anything and there was not a doctor or nurse to ask questions of.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I just think that most doctors just want to get done with one paitent and then move on to the next. I also don't think that they listen very attentatively when you tell them something that doesn't agree with their preconceptions of the person they think the patient is.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The fact that you never know if the doctor is going to find something that is terribly wrong with you or not.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I fell out of a tree and hurt my neck. I didn't actually think I was hurt that bad but I made myself stop what I was doing and think about it.  Then I realized I could have hurt myself badly even if it didn't feel like it at the time. I ended up having somebody take me to the hospital (they didn't think I was hurt much either).  I ended up have a shattered vertabrae in my neck.  good thing i went to the hospital.

Extremely capable of understanding information regarding my health and the decisions associated with it.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I believe we are all humans and humans make mistakes. So, although I trust my doctor they are not perfect.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The fear of the unknown at times. Awaiting test results anxiously and fearing the worst from them. Just the feeling of being mortal.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When my husband cut his finger, we wrapped it up to stop the bleeding and kept it above his heart until he received medical attention.

I fully can understand what I need to do to have decent health. I go to the doctor regulary and I have a complete open relationship with him
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor because he has never done me wrong. My old doctor was and old arrogant man that was not sympathetic to my problems and concerns so I know a good doctor when I get one.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I have "white coat syndrome" because my old doctor was often mean to me - part of the reason was my fault because I am a recovered alcoholic and I was drinking when I saw him and I was terrified he was going to find something major wrong with me
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have anxiety and my daughter also has it so I was able to give her some good tips on how to work through certain issues

I think with technology the way it is now, I have much better access to information that can help me understand what i need to make decisions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor.  He has never lied to me, or seemed to push me in any direction.  He gives me the information that i need, and his opinion, and leaves the decisions up to me.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am worried about getting bad news.  I also worry about being embarrassed or feeling awkward.  Usually it is the fear of bad news that worries me the most.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was able to diagnose my daughters epilepsy before we took her to a doctor.  She had small Absence seizures, and after some research i was able to correctly decide that is what it was.  The doctor confirmed this when we took her.

I think I have a better than average capability, because of my education and demographic and being a tive English speaker, but the information is still extremely confusing. It's hard to know if I'm asking the right questions or answering them in the best way possible to allow the doctors to help me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
It feels sometimes like they are extremely overbooked, and maybe get kickbacks from the insurance company for making certain recommendations. It's hard to trust doctors.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Fear of receiving bad news, fear of a painful procedure, fear of expensive medical bill
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

One time I drove up on a pretty serious car accident and had to help keep the victim calm and still until the ambulance arrived. I didn't know what to do, but I knew they could have interl injuries and shouldn't move.

Sometimes i have a hard time understanding certain medical procedures or whenever a doctor is explaining things to me. I do ask questions but i do not always understand the answers and sometimes i need help filling out forms because i don't know what to put.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust a doctor because they wouldnt have gotten here if they did not do well in medical school.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When i feel something is wrong with my body and I'm hoping it is nothing too bad.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When i had surgery, i had to be in a cast and if i did not take care of myself i would have had to have surgery all over again.

I always read each question carefully. I ask the receptionist for assistance if there is a question that I don't understand. I also proof read my answers for accuracy.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have been going to her for quite some time. I always ask her questions if I don't understand anything she tells me.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Sometimes I wonder if they will find something that might be a greater health risk. I wonder if it could be life threatening.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have always done research on what medical conditions are out there and what it would take to be considered at risk for those certain health conditions.

i think i understand somethings they say others or over my head. whe i get the bill is the hard part. i can't understand them
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
i trust him we are from a small town and see him al the time. he always ask how we are doing and remembers everything
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
if i think i have something bad going on. if i think it is bad i over think and get myself worked up
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
the only problem i hVe ever had is my apadx. i could tell you that is no fun and go to Tbe Dr imatily

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

My mother was a nurse and my father was an EMT so I grew up around medical terminology. I am used to hearing medical words and I feel like I am highly capable of processing and understanding basic health information. I often have an idea of what is wrong with me even before the doctor's diagnosis.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my physician because she has known my family for a long time and I know she would never do anything to double cross us. She is very knowledgable and is always very in depth with her examition of me, which shows that she cares. She speaks to me like a person and makes me feel comfortable, instead of trying to just prove how smart she is like some doctors do.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am most anxious or worried about them finding something I did not expect that will negatively impact my health. I am also worried that they will tell me I have been doing something wrong or that I am putting on too much weight.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I was at college, I began having severe symptoms of a UTI. However, I was not able to see a doctor regularly. I started drinking lots of fluids and cranberry juice and treating myself for a UTI before I was able to go into the doctor. When I went in she confirmed my assumptions and said that my proactivity in the situation prevented the infection from worsening and spreading up into my kidneys.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel basic medical information is easy to process, unless it is something that you are not aware of. Say for instance your blood pressure is up, you ask why and the answer is.. could be a number of things.. and that's it. I understand it is general, but sometimes the answers do not help at all.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I guess it is I trust my doctor to make decisions and help find answers. It is the unexplained sickness or pain that seems like all doctors avoid. You always have to see several doctors instead of just a few and that's when it seems like your being pushed through the system. If someone finds something, or another test is run.. I want to know why.. and what the findings are. Some don't let you know anything after tests are done.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I think it is just the unexpected. I'm ok as long as I know what is going to happen, but if I don't .. then I get anxious - confused - nervous and sometimes upset.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My first husband was diagnosed with a Glioblastoma multiforma? tumor. There were alot of hospital and drs appts that we had to go to. Blood sugars that were bounced more than Tigger and it was hard trying to find ways to control it.

I think that I have good knowledge but thankfully I have never been in a health situation except when I had my two children.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She listens to me, repeats back to me my concerns and has given me no reason not to trust her. She takes the time necessary to understand my needs and questions
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Sometimes health issues come out of seemingly nowhere and even though I try to live as healthy as I can, I am concerned that I might have a condition. Family history tells me I could get certain health conditions.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I went to college for four years to become a Medical Laboratory Scientist. It eqipped me to know a fair amount about disease and health conditions. Though I am not always the best with math word problems.

i will ask a doctor for anything that i need to know regarding documents that i need to sign and anything else that is needed to know or explain.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
i trust my doctor knowing that he/she had medical training and education and i don't
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
i don't like waiting for results especially if it was for something that might be serious.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I have a pretty good grasp on understanding the various aspects of healthcare. I make sure to read materials thoroughly and, like with contracts, I always make sure to read fine print and ask questions about things I do not understand. The internet allows me to do basic research on things I might need to ask or clarify. I trust my doctors to provide me with the proper information and I trust them to explain things to me in terms that I can understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor has little reason to lie to me, so I can trust in them to provide me with the proper care. I do question medications when I can, as I know that doctors receive kickbacks and things like that from companies. I try to make sure to use holistic methods when I can. Medications can be dangerous and harmful if you become addicted to them. I prefer to use natural methods when I can, so that I can avoid anything unnecessary.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Just being there is sometimes unsettling. It is hard to keep bad thoughts out when you are surrounded by sick people and the smell of a doctor's office. However, I know that my health is separate from others, so I try to keep the bad thoughts out by focusing on myself first. I get a little uneasy when waiting for test results or after an exam, but I know that I can get over it quickly.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have been sick before and gone to the doctor because I felt that something was different. I noticed my symptoms were slightly different from previous sickness and because of that I decided that seeing a doctor was a good idea. It turned out to be nothing, but I try to be careful when something is different from previous experiences.

Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I was called in to the draft board for a physical to see if I qualified for the military I was 18 years old. I knew I had high blood pressure but had never had it checked by a doctor. Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am too old to worry about the stupid stuff. Tons of doctors have seen my junk. I had a nursing class watch me give birth. (I was the only one not screaming, it was my 3rd kid). So unless someone was going to do a procedure that I knew was going to hurt really bad I do not get anxious.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had chest pain and numbness in my left arm. Been complaining for years. Workers comp kept telling me it was carpel tunnel. Ended up having bypass surgery at the Mayo Clinic. My personal doctor finally asked at a physical if I was still having chest pain. They FINALLY did a stress test. Two parts of my heart were not lighting up. (not getting blood flow). They did not even bother running the test. Maybe because I was a woman, not terribly old, I don't know why they would not order a stress test. But I am glad I never let them do carpel tunnel surgery.

I went to a doctor about it and they confirmed that it was that.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My physician is condescending. Usually when I have questions they're met with a 'duh' attitude or as if it's something I don't need to know. I struggle with making regular visits because I end up feeling angry and marginalized.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I hate it when they arrive late. I'm left sitting in a filthy room, waiting for them to come in and put their cold hands on me. Once she arrives, she is busy logging on to her computer and trying to convince me that I need to go on some blood pressure medication when I've never had high blood pressure in my life. It shoots straight up when I visit the hospital in anticipation of ill treatment.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My father-in-law has a lot of health issues but is fairly stable most of the time. He started acting strange - not sleeping, smoking more frequently. I told my husband to get him to the doctor before he died - turns out he had renal failure and would have died if a few more hours had passed. I just noticed a change in behavior and knew something was very wrong.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

All doctors follow rules and procedures that are generalized for everyone and not for me. They may or may not take me 100% at my word when I describe symptoms and feelings and will not provide all options if they don't approve of one. I've only been able to get full information when I pressed and asked, although I have encountered some doctors that did let me make the fil decision without judgement. I feel I know my body best, and often they don't take that same attitude.

That they will press on an issue that I don't feel like looking into or that I don't feel is serious. That they will refuse to continue seeing me if I don't do some kind of testing that I don't want to do. That they will think I'm lying when I say I have no issues.
